reviews.review_msg: Pretty average class, but lack of clarity on homework is stressful. A lot of the material for the class topic is 20+ years old, so my major concern is the lack of updated materials she uses. Lots of readings too, and she unfortunately does not go over the main ideas well. In the beginning yes, but later on no. Expectations are high too.

Professor Spear is encouraging of students to share their own thoughts about materials in discussions. She is a fair marker and gives good feedback. She assigns a variety of interesting readings and is thoughtful about what students can learn from them. Her expectations are fair.

Good with social historysociological explanations of things, but I feel like I know the bare-bones of American history. She's really dismissive about the importance of (key!!!) battles in history and doesn't go over them - at all. Thin lectures, not much information that you couldn't look up on Wikipedia. Good readings, though!
Great Teacher. This class was interesting and engaging.
great preparation, clear expectations, super interesting classes and she seems like she genuinely cares about students. I've taken two classes from her and have never heard any complaints.

Interesting and informative lectures and clear expectations. I was excited to take this class and it did not disappoint. Assignments were marked fairly and returned quickly. The tutorial was helpful and the TA great. I would definitely try to take another class from her. The only caution would be don?t take this class if you want a detailed history
Dr. Spear is a really nice prof but her lecture are really, really boring. Overall an easy marker and her choice of TA was really good.

Great, enthusiastic teacher. Loved her class and it made me want to take more american history. Tests are fair and work is limited to tutorial readings and a 500, and 1200 word paper with midterm and final. Highly recommended!

Jennifer sincerely loves the subject that she teaches.  I really appreciate her effort and her keen interest in American History, but !!!! HER LECTURES ARE SO BORING!!!  TA Eden was AMAZING! Other than that, a good solid B!

Professor Spear is a fantastic prof who really looks at history in a non-traditional way. I know somebody ranted in The Peak a few months back that history should be about old, white men and the things they did, but I really disagree and this course is an excellent example of social history. I totally recommend taking her classes!

Loved Ms. Spear. She made sure -- like the other commenter noted -- that this was a sociological journey into history, rather than merely a laundry list of facts. I did not find that the class was feminism or racism-centric, but honestly since she doesn't like battle history, those are the areas that would be the most attention-grabbing.

think of her lectures as historical sociology and not merely regurgitation of stereotypical facts and dates. She really endevours to make students think about the implications of positional power and its effect on how history is portrayed. TA was very helpfull!

Agree with the former comment. Although I enjoy the history of Native Americans, African Americans, and women, she acts like no one else even existed in American history. its basically a class on women, and she manages to turn early American history into a class on feminism.
